speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: SCENE III. Before Angiers.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Alarum. Excursions. Enter JOAN LA PUCELLE

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: The regent conquers, and the Frenchmen fly.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Now help, ye charming spells and periapts;

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: And ye choice spirits that admonish me

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: And give me signs of future accidents.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Thunder

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: You speedy helpers, that are substitutes

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Under the lordly monarch of the north,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Appear and aid me in this enterprise.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Enter Fiends

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: This speedy and quick appearance argues proof

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Of your accustom'd diligence to me.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Now, ye familiar spirits, that are cull'd

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Out of the powerful regions under earth,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Help me this once, that France may get the field.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: They walk, and speak not

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: O, hold me not with silence over-long!

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Where I was wont to feed you with my blood,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: I'll lop a member off and give it you

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: In earnest of further benefit,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: So you do condescend to help me now.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: They hang their heads

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: No hope to have redress? My body shall

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Pay recompense, if you will grant my suit.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: They shake their heads

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Cannot my body nor blood-sacrifice

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Entreat you to your wonted furtherance?

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Then take my soul, my body, soul and all,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Before that England give the French the foil.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: They depart

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: See, they forsake me! Now the time is come

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: That France must vail her lofty-plumed crest

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: And let her head fall into England's lap.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: My ancient incantations are too weak,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: And hell too strong for me to buckle with:

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Now, France, thy glory droopeth to the dust.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Excursions. Re-enter JOAN LA PUCELLE fighting hand  to hand with YORK. JOAN LA PUCELLE is taken. The French fly.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Damsel of France, I think I have you fast:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Unchain your spirits now with spelling charms

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And try if they can gain your liberty.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: A goodly prize, fit for the devil's grace!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: See, how the ugly wench doth bend her brows,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: As if with Circe she would change my shape!

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Changed to a worser shape thou canst not be.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: O, Charles the Dauphin is a proper man;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: No shape but his can please your dainty eye.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: A plaguing mischief light on Charles and thee!

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: And may ye both be suddenly surprised

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: By bloody hands, in sleeping on your beds!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Fell banning hag, enchantress, hold thy tongue!

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: I prithee, give me leave to curse awhile.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Curse, miscreant, when thou comest to the stake.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Alarum. Enter SUFFOLK with MARGARET in his hand

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Be what thou wilt, thou art my prisoner.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Gazes on her

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: O fairest beauty, do not fear nor fly!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For I will touch thee but with reverent hands;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I kiss these fingers for eternal peace,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And lay them gently on thy tender side.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Who art thou? say, that I may honour thee.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Margaret my name, and daughter to a king,

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: The King of Naples, whosoe'er thou art.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: An earl I am, and Suffolk am I call'd.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Be not offended, nature's miracle,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thou art allotted to be ta'en by me:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So doth the swan her downy cygnets save,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Keeping them prisoner underneath her wings.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Yet, if this servile usage once offend.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Go, and be free again, as Suffolk's friend.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: She is going

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: O, stay! I have no power to let her pass;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: My hand would free her, but my heart says no

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As plays the sun upon the glassy streams,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Twinkling another counterfeited beam,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So seems this gorgeous beauty to mine eyes.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Fain would I woo her, yet I dare not speak:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I'll call for pen and ink, and write my mind.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Fie, de la Pole! disable not thyself;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Hast not a tongue? is she not here?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Wilt thou be daunted at a woman's sight?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Ay, beauty's princely majesty is such,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Confounds the tongue and makes the senses rough.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Say, Earl of Suffolk--if thy name be so--

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: What ransom must I pay before I pass?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: For I perceive I am thy prisoner.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: How canst thou tell she will deny thy suit,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Before thou make a trial of her love?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Why speak'st thou not? what ransom must I pay?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: She's beautiful, and therefore to be woo'd;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: She is a woman, therefore to be won.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Wilt thou accept of ransom? yea, or no.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Fond man, remember that thou hast a wife;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Then how can Margaret be thy paramour?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: I were best to leave him, for he will not hear.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: There all is marr'd; there lies a cooling card.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: He talks at random; sure, the man is mad.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And yet a dispensation may be had.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: And yet I would that you would answer me.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I'll win this Lady Margaret. For whom?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Why, for my king: tush, that's a wooden thing!

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: He talks of wood: it is some carpenter.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Yet so my fancy may be satisfied,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And peace established between these realms

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But there remains a scruple in that too;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For though her father be the King of Naples,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Duke of Anjou and Maine, yet is he poor,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And our nobility will scorn the match.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Hear ye, captain, are you not at leisure?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: It shall be so, disdain they ne'er so much.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Henry is youthful and will quickly yield.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Madam, I have a secret to reveal.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: What though I be enthrall'd? he seems a knight,

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: And will not any way dishonour me.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Lady, vouchsafe to listen what I say.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Perhaps I shall be rescued by the French;

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: And then I need not crave his courtesy.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Sweet madam, give me a hearing in a cause--

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Tush, women have been captivate ere now.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Lady, wherefore talk you so?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: I cry you mercy, 'tis but Quid for Quo.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Say, gentle princess, would you not suppose

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Your bondage happy, to be made a queen?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: To be a queen in bondage is more vile

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Than is a slave in base servility;

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: For princes should be free.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And so shall you,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: If happy England's royal king be free.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Why, what concerns his freedom unto me?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I'll undertake to make thee Henry's queen,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To put a golden sceptre in thy hand

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And set a precious crown upon thy head,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: If thou wilt condescend to be my--

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: What?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: His love.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: I am unworthy to be Henry's wife.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No, gentle madam; I unworthy am

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To woo so fair a dame to be his wife,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And have no portion in the choice myself.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: How say you, madam, are ye so content?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: An if my father please, I am content.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Then call our captains and our colours forth.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And, madam, at your father's castle walls

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: We'll crave a parley, to confer with him.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A parley sounded. Enter REIGNIER on the walls

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: See, Reignier, see, thy daughter prisoner!

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: To whom?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To me.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Suffolk, what remedy?

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: I am a soldier, and unapt to weep,

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Or to exclaim on fortune's fickleness.

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: Yes, there is remedy enough, my lord:

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: Consent, and for thy honour give consent,

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: Thy daughter shall be wedded to my king;

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: Whom I with pain have woo'd and won thereto;

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: And this her easy-held imprisonment

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: Hath gained thy daughter princely liberty.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Speaks Suffolk as he thinks?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Fair Margaret knows

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That Suffolk doth not flatter, face, or feign.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Upon thy princely warrant, I descend

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: To give thee answer of thy just demand.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Exit from the walls

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And here I will expect thy coming.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Trumpets sound. Enter REIGNIER, below

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Welcome, brave earl, into our territories:

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Command in Anjou what your honour pleases.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thanks, Reignier, happy for so sweet a child,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Fit to be made companion with a king:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: What answer makes your grace unto my suit?

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Since thou dost deign to woo her little worth

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: To be the princely bride of such a lord;

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Upon condition I may quietly

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Enjoy mine own, the country Maine and Anjou,

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Free from oppression or the stroke of war,

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: My daughter shall be Henry's, if he please.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That is her ransom; I deliver her;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And those two counties I will undertake

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Your grace shall well and quietly enjoy.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: And I again, in Henry's royal name,

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: As deputy unto that gracious king,

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Give thee her hand, for sign of plighted faith.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Reignier of France, I give thee kingly thanks,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Because this is in traffic of a king.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Aside

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And yet, methinks, I could be well content

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To be mine own attorney in this case.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I'll over then to England with this news,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And make this marriage to be solemnized.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So farewell, Reignier: set this diamond safe

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: In golden palaces, as it becomes.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: I do embrace thee, as I would embrace

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: The Christian prince, King Henry, were he here.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Farewell, my lord: good wishes, praise and prayers

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Shall Suffolk ever have of Margaret.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Going

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Farewell, sweet madam: but hark you, Margaret;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No princely commendations to my king?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Such commendations as becomes a maid,

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: A virgin and his servant, say to him.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Words sweetly placed and modestly directed.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But madam, I must trouble you again;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No loving token to his majesty?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Yes, my good lord, a pure unspotted heart,

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Never yet taint with love, I send the king.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And this withal.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Kisses her

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: That for thyself: I will not so presume

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: To send such peevish tokens to a king.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Exeunt REIGNIER and MARGARET

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: O, wert thou for myself! But, Suffolk, stay;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thou mayst not wander in that labyrinth;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: There Minotaurs and ugly treasons lurk.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Solicit Henry with her wondrous praise:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Bethink thee on her virtues that surmount,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And natural graces that extinguish art;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Repeat their semblance often on the seas,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That, when thou comest to kneel at Henry's feet,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thou mayst bereave him of his wits with wonder.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Exit
